text: it should be displayed I think, but the problem is that I guess you want svg files, but if documenter splices a returned svg directly into your output, it's not scaled to fit. that's why I save all svgs manually currently and only make it look like I'm returning the figure

elements.text: it should be displayed I think, but the problem is that I guess you want svg files, but if documenter splices a returned svg directly into your output, it's not scaled to fit. that's why I save all svgs manually currently and only make it look like I'm returning the figure

text: because when you insert them as images, they scale down if the column width is smaller than the file

elements.text: because when you insert them as images, they scale down if the column width is smaller than the file

text: They are not displayed, this I can tell you for my experience. Simply returning a CairoMakie figure as the last argument of an `@example` block does not display the figure in the built docs

text:
ah yes,
```save("step_001.svg", fig) # hide
nothing # hide
```
![step_001](step_001.svg)```
is the same trick I use in PyPlot.jl

text: <@UK1BNFHFV> I apologize, I was incorrect. Simply returning the `figure` object at the end of the `@example` block _is enough to display it_. I was simply not doing it correctly.
